column1: Redwater was a river that ran near the eastern fringes of the known part of Middle-earth. It rose among the Iron Hills
column3: and from there it flowed southwards until it met the River River Running in the middle of that rivers course. Its name is direct translation of the Elvish Carnen
column4: and seems to be a literal description: rivers that flow out of land with strong iron deposits do indeed show a distinctive red-orange colour in their water.

column1: Little is known of the peoples who lived along the river
column2: except for the Northmen who lived in the lands west of the Redwater in the Third Age. These Men enjoyed a strong alliance with the Dwarves of the Iron Hills
column3: maintaining a prosperous community in this region.
